segment.source: Help secure your system by applying the appropriate security updates for Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.
segment.target: Help secure your system by applying the appropriate security updates for Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.

segment.source: You can update MED-V interactively, by the end user, or silently by using an electronic software distribution system.
segment.target: You can update MED-V interactively, by the end user, or silently by using an electronic software distribution system.

segment.source: Installation of the MED-V Host Agent upgrades the MED-V Host Agent and then updates the MED-V workspace if required.
segment.target: Installation of the MED-V Host Agent upgrades the MED-V Host Agent and then updates the MED-V workspace if required.

segment.source: The MED-V Host Agent and Guest Agent keep in sync.
segment.target: The MED-V Host Agent and Guest Agent keep in sync.

segment.source: If applications are running from the MED-V workspace while the MED-V Host Agent is being updated, a restart of the host computer is required to complete the update.
segment.target: If applications are running from the MED-V workspace while the MED-V Host Agent is being updated, a restart of the host computer is required to complete the update.

segment.source: If no applications are running, MED-V is restarted automatically and the upgrade is completed without a restart of the host computer.
segment.target: If no applications are running, MED-V is restarted automatically and the upgrade is completed without a restart of the host computer.

segment.source: If you are updating MED-V by using an electronic software distribution system, you can control the restart behavior.
segment.target: If you are updating MED-V by using an electronic software distribution system, you can control the restart behavior.

segment.source: To do this, suppress the restart by typing REBOOT=”ReallySuppress” at the command prompt when installing MED-VHostAgentSetup.exe.
segment.target: To do this, suppress the restart by typing REBOOT=”ReallySuppress” at the command prompt when installing MED-VHostAgentSetup.exe.

segment.source: Then, configure the electronic software distribution system to capture the 3010 return code (which signals that a restart is required) and perform the set restart behavior.
segment.target: Then, configure the electronic software distribution system to capture the 3010 return code (which signals that a restart is required) and perform the set restart behavior.
